EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────

• Fluid System Submodule (Boiler Module) comprising:

 – Repositioned Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with boiler at (x=-10.0, y=22.5) and steam engine at (x=-7.5, y=11.5).
 – Additional attempted Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with boiler at (x=-7.0, y=23.5) and steam engine at (x=1.5, y=28.5).

### New Network Structures
• Long-distance Transport Belt Network at approximate span (input near x=-3.5, y=10.5; output near x=22.5, y=10.5)
 – Consists of a Belt Group with an input Belt at (x=-3.5, y=10.5) and an output Belt at (x=22.5, y=10.5) comprising 29 belts.
 – Use-case: Facilitates long‐range material transfer between distant factory zones.

• Copper Ore Transport Line at approximate region (x≈8–9, y≈11–15)
 – Consists of a Belt Group with inputs from Belt at (x=8.5, y=11.5) (direction DOWN) and Belt at (x=7.5, y=15.5) (direction RIGHT) and output via Belt at (x=8.5, y=15.5) (direction RIGHT) comprising 6 belts carrying copper-ore.

• Integrated Auxiliary Transport Network at approximate center (x≈3, y≈16)
 – Consists of a Belt Group with inputs from Belts at (x=2.5, y=13.5), (x=2.5, y=15.5), and (x=5.5, y=18.5) comprising 23 belts.
 – Connected to a secondary Belt Group with inputs from Belts at (x=3.5, y=16.5) and (x=2.5, y=25.5) and outputs at (x=3.5, y=16.5) and (x=4.5, y=16.5) comprising 16 belts.
 – Use-case: Provides intermediate material transfer within localized production areas.

• Short Belt Connector A at approximate location (x≈-0.5 to -1.5, y≈20.5)
 – Consists of a Belt Group with an input Belt at (x=-0.5, y=20.5) and an output Belt at (x=-1.5, y=20.5) comprising 2 belts.
 – Use-case: Links adjacent factory sections with a minimal belt segment.

• Short Belt Connector B at approximate location (x≈-4.5 to -5.5 and nearby segments)
 – Consists of a Belt Group with an input Belt at (x=-4.5, y=25.5) and an output Belt at (x=-5.5, y=25.5) comprising 2 belts.
 – Includes additional belt segments at (x=-2.5, y=26.5) and (x=-1.5, y=27.5).
 – Use-case: Enhances local belt connectivity in the higher-y production zone.

(Other structures from previous steps remain unchanged.)

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Inventory and Crafting:
 – Verify that required items exist in inventory before placement actions. Insufficient inventory (e.g., “No stone_furnace in inventory”) can lead to crafting delays and placement errors.

• Fuel and Operational Readiness:
 – Monitor and replenish fuel for burner inserters and furnaces. Consistent “out of fuel” or “waiting for source items” issues indicate the need for timely coal refills.

• Placement Validation:
 – Confirm that target locations are unobstructed and free from unsuitable terrain (such as water) to avoid placement failures (e.g., inability to place a stone furnace at (-6.0, 19.0)).
 – Before relying on alternative buildable positions, ensure that position properties (like buildable_area.center) are accessed correctly without treating non-callable objects as functions.

• Furnace Operation and Extraction:
 – Ensure furnaces have completed processing and contain the expected products before extraction attempts. Extraction errors (such as being unable to extract copper-plate from a furnace) may require verifying furnace output and, if necessary, inserting fuel to facilitate smelting.

• Fluid System Connectivity and Power Network:
 – Continue to confirm proper pipe and pole placements to mitigate errors related to “no input liquid,” “no fluid present in connections,” and network power warnings.
